page.title: 11TOURISM AROUND TYWARDREATH
page.content: Although our region is{not primarily a {tourist area,}the village of Tywardreath is very much connected with the coastal village of Par, so summer tourists are catered for by a number of private houses offering{"Bed {and Breakfast."}In the village there is also a{guest house.} At{Penpillick}there is a hotel and restaurant and a{Youth Hostel}at Penquite. East of Tywardreath is a house called{ {Trenython}which was built by{Col. {Peard,}who fought in the Italian Wars and whom{Garibaldi}came here to visit. Later the house became the{Bishop's {Palace}for Bishop Gott. It has also been a{Convalescent Home}for railwaymen and is now a{time share {complex} and country club. Tourists also visit the church at{St. {Winnow}and the monument at{Castle Dore
